definitions.definition: the area around a particular place

examples.text: Crowds gathered in the vicinity of Trafalgar Square.
There is no hospital **in the immediate vicinity**.
The police suggested that he leave the vicinity of the property.
He usually objected strongly to anyone smoking in his vicinity (= near him).

wordOrigin: mid 16th cent. (in the sense ‘proximity’): from Latin vicinitas, from vicinus ‘neighbour’.
